brief_description: The purpose of this study was to establish a multi-center kidney donor database containing renal failure, cardiovascular and overall mortality information for the complete cohorts of kidney donors who underwent living donor uninephrectomy.
description: The purpose of this study was to establish a multi-center kidney donor database containing renal failure, cardiovascular and overall mortality information for the complete cohorts of kidney donors who underwent living donor uninephrectomy.
endpoints:
The primary endpoints of this study are:
  1. Overall mortality
  2. Cause-specific mortality
  3. End stage renal disease (ESRD) defined as a composite endpoint of initiation of dialysis, listing for kidney transplantation or receipt of kidney transplantation
The secondary endpoints of this study are:
  1. Cardiovascular and renal morbidity following donor nephrectomy
  2. Six-month incidence of adverse events (to be defined) following donor nephrectomy for live donors after a date to be determined
hypothesis: Overall mortality rates, cardiovascular mortality rates, and incidence of end stage renal disease of subjects who underwent living donor uninephrectomy are similar to expected age-, sex- and race-specific rates in the general US population.
objectives: To compare the observed rates of overall mortality, cardiac-specific mortality, end stage renal disease to expected rates from the age-, sex- and race-specific US population, and to identify predictors of mortality in kidney donors who underwent living donor uninephrectomy.

arm.description: People who donated a kidney at University of Alabama at Birmingham,  University of Minnesota, or Mayo Clinic from August 2007 until June 2011
arm.name: Living Kidney Donors

personnel.organization: Division of Nephrology and Hypertension, Mayo Clinic
